Hm, i don't know much about some of these mods, but that seems like a duplication issue, some mod seems to be duplicating the tanks but not hiding the old ones.

I'm not familiar with some of these mods, sorry. But i would recomend removing one, opening the game, and see if that changes something, if not, repeat until you find the culprit.

On 6/15/2023 at 10:21 PM, Davi SDF said:

Hm, i don't know much about some of these mods, but that seems like a duplication issue, some mod seems to be duplicating the tanks but not hiding the old ones.

I'm not familiar with some of these mods, sorry. But i would recomend removing one, opening the game, and see if that changes something, if not, repeat until you find the culprit.

right I have figured out what the hell is going on
Apparently when downloading kerbal atomics I moved the gamedata folder into the gamedata folder
basically, it now has a gamedata/gamedata/kerbalatomics stacked folder now

20 hours ago, howardxu23 said:

right I have figured out what the hell is going on
Apparently when downloading kerbal atomics I moved the gamedata folder into the gamedata folder
basically, it now has a gamedata/gamedata/kerbalatomics stacked folder now

I see, i'm happy that you figured it out!

Hello!

I'm having trouble with the fuel tanks from Universal Storage 2 - the option for switching fuel is there in the VAB but when you switch to any fuel other than LF+OX the option for fuel amount disappear, and the tanks are empty. I've tried to make sense of the config files but I don't understand how to make it work, unfortunately.

This only applies to the tanks for US2 - all other tanks work well.  I made a post about this in the US2 thread but wanted to ask here as well in case others are searching for the same issue. US2 thread here

 

Regards and thanks in advance,

2 hours ago, Stridsape said:

Hello!

I'm having trouble with the fuel tanks from Universal Storage 2 - the option for switching fuel is there in the VAB but when you switch to any fuel other than LF+OX the option for fuel amount disappear, and the tanks are empty. I've tried to make sense of the config files but I don't understand how to make it work, unfortunately.

This only applies to the tanks for US2 - all other tanks work well.  I made a post about this in the US2 thread but wanted to ask here as well in case others are searching for the same issue. US2 thread here

 

Regards and thanks in advance,

Do you have another mod for fuelswitch like interstellar fuelswitch or real fuels?

Why is there Cryo Tanks AND Cryo Tanks Core installed? There should only Cryo Tanks in your folder. Cryo Tanks Core is only a standalone version of the plugin without the Tanks. But the plugin is included in Cryo Tanks.

21 minutes ago, Cheesecake said:

Why is there Cryo Tanks AND Cryo Tanks Core installed? There should only Cryo Tanks in your folder. Cryo Tanks Core is only a standalone version of the plugin without the Tanks. But the plugin is included in Cryo Tanks.

Good question - I wasn't aware I had both installed until now! Must have happened sometime I reinstalled mods.

Can I safely remove the CryoTanks Core then? Maybe that will fix it.

11 minutes ago, Stridsape said:

Good question - I wasn't aware I had both installed until now! Must have happened sometime I reinstalled mods.

Can I safely remove the CryoTanks Core then? Maybe that will fix it.

Yes you can. And maybe that`s the problem.

6 minutes ago, Cheesecake said:

Yes you can. And maybe that`s the problem.

 

Hmm, doesn't seem to work sadly. Can't be removed via CKAN - Cryo tanks Core is a dependency of Cryo tanks.

Maybe I can delete the standalone plugin somehow but I don't know what to remove, it's not a separate folder in Gamedata...

I have encountered a bug where, despite having plenty of empty LH2 tank space on a craft, the ISRU converter insists that LH2 is full.

Clearly it worked for a fraction of a second, because there is some LH2 in there, but then it stopped. I know it can work because I was able to fully fill a 5m tank then partially fill it again before running into this bug.

Any help would be appreciated.

I just started a fresh save, and for whatever reason, the boiloff functionality isn't working on any of my tanks, including the stock ones. They are all showing the correct resources from CryoTanks, but the boiloff aspect appears to be missing. Any ideas on a potential cause?

7 hours ago, dlrk said:

I just started a fresh save, and for whatever reason, the boiloff functionality isn't working on any of my tanks, including the stock ones. They are all showing the correct resources from CryoTanks, but the boiloff aspect appears to be missing. Any ideas on a potential cause?

Did you shutoff Boiloff in the settings of System Heat?

9 hours ago, Cheesecake said:

Did you shutoff Boiloff in the settings of System Heat?

Not knowingly - do I have to manually turn it on?
Yep, disabling systemheat boiloff fixed it. Is systemheat boiloff just something you don't see on the tanks?

Does anyone have an already-made config file that patches radiance boiloff and hydrogen generation on everything? Even better if it makes all the cryo tanks and engines use LiquidOxygen with boiloff too. I want to be able to run a fuel cell from boiloff.
